title: Madison Beer looks ravishing in all lime green ensemble at the Austin City Limits music festival
text:
Only some can make head-to-toe sweat clothes look fierce, and songstress Madison Beer is among those few.

The Hurts Like Hell singer, 20, rocked a baggy neon lime green ensemble on Friday, which kicked off the second weekend of the two-weekend Austin City Limits Music Festival in Zilker Metropolitan Park in Austin, Texas.

Beer accented the simple yet bold look with some jewelry, including a pair of thick hoops in her ears, a gold necklace, and various rings.

Lime green siren: Madison Beer rocked a baggy neon lime green ensemble on Friday, which kicked off the second weekend of the two-weekend Austin City Limits Music Festival

The gorgeous brunette sported a perfectly made up face that still appeared subtle.

Madison had a long, cream-colored manicure, and let her raven locks cascade in waves over her shoulders.

She sang at a microphone stand that was adorned with chains and leaves.

She also took to Instagram for the occasion, putting together an Instagram story of fan-captured footage of her performance.

Sing it sister: Beer accented the simple yet bold look with some jewelry, including a pair of thick hoops in her ears, a gold necklace, and various rings

An angel indeed: She also took to Instagram for the occasion, putting together an Instagram story of fan-captured footage of her performance

She started the slideshow with a closeup of her green sweatshirt and captioned it, 'Thank U Austin' with a black heart emoji.

Other headliners at the popular Texas festival include Guns N' Roses, Billie Eilish, Cardi B, Kacey Musgraves and many, many more.

Beer got her start when she was discovered by Justin Bieber at age 13 with a cover of Etta James.

Effortless beauty: Only some can make head-to-toe sweat clothes look fierce, and Madison is among those few

Making magic music: She sang at a microphone stand that was adorned with chains and leaves

Since, Madison has been working hard on her own music.

She released her debut extended play, As She Pleases, in 2018, and that same year also released her collaboration with Offset, Hurts Like Hell.

Madison boasts over 13 million followers on Instagram alone, and earlier this year opened up about her complicated relationship with social media in her new single, Dear Society.
